modules.description: Represents and manipulates vCard group identifiers. Provides functions to create a group with a given name, retrieve its string representation, and access an empty group instance. Useful for organizing related vCard properties under a common group label.

This module represents and manipulates values used in vCard data. It provides functions to convert values to strings and create values from strings. The primary data type is `t`, which encapsulates vCard field values for structured handling. Use this module when constructing or processing vCard entries, such as formatting contact information or parsing vCard strings.

This module constructs vCard data structures by appending content lines, photos, and structured fields with optional groups and parameters. It operates on a `t` type representing a vCard, and supports adding encoded photo data directly or from files. Concrete use cases include generating vCard files for contact information with embedded media and custom field groupings.

This module defines a variant type representing standard vCard property names and provides a function to convert these property names to their string representations. It works with the `t` type, which includes constants for common vCard fields like `FN`, `EMAIL`, and `TEL`, as well as extensible `X_NAME` for custom properties. Concrete use cases include generating valid vCard property headers and serializing vCard data structures to text.

This module defines a data structure for representing parameters in a vCard, consisting of a name and a list of values. It provides functions to create parameter instances from a name and a single value or multiple values. These constructs are used to build and manipulate vCard properties with structured parameters, such as specifying alternate representations of a name or contact information.

This module defines a content line in a vCard, consisting of a group, name, parameters, and value. It provides a function to construct such content lines, allowing optional group specification. Concrete use cases include generating formatted vCard fields like "FN" (full name) or "EMAIL" with associated parameters and values.

This module generates vCard data by organizing content lines with groups, property names, parameters, and values. It supports creating structured contact entries with custom fields, embedded photos, and standard vCard properties like names and email addresses. Use it to produce valid vCard files for contact sharing, serialization, and structured data export.
